FuncDef: The test connectivity controller cpos e1 command enables the system to test the bit error rate of an E1 channel of a CPOS interface.
CLIs: test connectivity controller cpos <controller-number> e1 <e1-number> { unframed | channelized timeslot-list <slot-list> } duration <time>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63.

Indicates that the E1 channel of a CPOS interface works in unframed mode.
-

Indicates that the E1 channel of a CPOS interface works in unframed mode.
-

Specifies the number or the range of the timeslots to be bundled.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 31. You can specify either a single timeslot or a range of timeslots. A comma (,) is used to separate timeslots, and a hyphen (-) is used to specify a timeslot range.

Specifies the bit error rate test duration for an E1 channel of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 10, in seconds.

Specifies the number of a CPOS interface.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] test connectivity controller cpos 1/0/0 e1 10 unframed duration 3
Warning: The traffic on this interface will be interrupted if the operation is p
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When faults occur on an E1 channel of a CPOS interface, you can run the test connectivity cpos e1 command to test the bit error rate of this channel.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The working mode of the E1 channel must be the same as that of the CPOS interface.
